Mother-offspring and nest mate resemblance but no heritability in early-life telomere length in white-throated dippers
Philipp J. J. Becker, Sophie Reichert, Sandrine Zahn, Johann Hegelbach, Sylvie Massemin, Lukas F. Keller, Erik Postma, François Criscuolo

---

ANIMAL, MOTHER, FATHER: sequential number for an individual (offspring) and its dam and sire
NEST: unique nest identity
BYEAR: year of birth
SEX: female (F), male (M)
HATCH: day of hatching (julian day, January 1st is day 1)
AGE: Age in days at sampling
RIVER: name of river of birth
INBR: inbreeding coefficient
MASS: body mass, residuals from a model correcting for age at measurement
TARSUS: tarsus length, residuals from a model correcting for age at measurement
NESTLINGS: number of nestlings (at the time of ringing, measurement and blood sampling)
TEL: relative telomere length
RESID.TEL: residuals of a model of TEL against year of birth and inbreeding coefficient

---

ANIMAL	NEST	MOTHER	FATHER	BYEAR	SEX	HATCH	AGE	RIVER	INBR	MASS	TARSUS	NESTLINGS	TEL	resid.tel
